availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Native of Goochland County, Virginia. Graduated from the University of Virginia in 1829. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1830. Moved to Texas in 1834 where he served as the Attorney General for the district of Eastern Texas. Moved back to Kentucky where he served in the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1848 and the Kentucky Senate from 1849-1853. Twice elected as a representative to the U.S. House from 1853 to 1857. Worked as the U.S. consul in Glasgow, Scotland from 1862 to September 1864. Owned 28 slaves in 1860.

Spouse: Lucy C Underwood
Children: Joanna Underwood, Warner Underwood, Henry Underwood, John Underwood, Mary Underwood

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, page 157.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, page 38.
Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, "Warner Lewis Underwood," http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=U000016 accessed 05/17/2017.
